title: Services planned for Haverhill police officer, 32, who died ‘unexpectedly’
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Katelyn Tully, a decorated army veteran who served in Afghanistan for six months, will be buried with military honors.
The funeral for a Haverhill police officer who died “unexpectedly” Sept.
26 will be held Friday, according to her obituary.

title: Garrett Crochet dominates and other takeaways from Red Sox’s Game 1 win over Yankees

title: Worcester mother detained by ICE in high-profile arrest granted asylum
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira has been in custody since May.
DHS has 30 days to appeal the judge's decision, during which she will remain in custody in New Hampshire.
A Worcester resident joined a rally outside city hall May 13, 2025 after Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira was detained and two others arrested by local police.

title: ‘That is what second-rate franchises do’: Yankees’ ticket policy draws criticism
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Red Sox Despite the furor, a Yankees spokesperson pointed out that the policy has been in place since 2018.
Romy Gonzalez can't beat the throw to first base for the out during the first inning of Game 1 of the Red Sox-Yankees wild-card series.

AP Photo/Frank Franklin II Red Sox fans hoping for a chance to travel to New York to watch the latest postseason chapter in the rivalry with the Yankees were greeted to a discouraging “Important Event Policy” on Ticketmaster.

title: Ty Law: Patriots have their ‘successor to Tom Brady’ in Drake Maye
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He is ‘the guy,’ he's proven himself.
" Drake Maye is starting to settle into a groove in his second NFL season.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 30, 2025 | 7:02 PM 2 minutes to read Count Pro Football Hall of Famer Ty Law among those who have been impressed with what they’ve seen from Patriots QB Drake Maye so far this season.

title: Fall River man sentenced for raping 14-year-old girl who was hitchhiking
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Trevon Hector, 38, previously pleaded guilty to raping and abusing a child and possessing child pornography By Sana Muneer September 30, 2025 | 6:29 PM 1 minute to read A Fall River man will serve five to seven years in state prison for raping a 14-year-old girl who was hitchhiking, prosecutors announced Tuesday.
Trevon Hector, 38, will also serve a concurrent sentence of four and half to five years for child porn possession, Bristol County District Attorney Thomas Quinn said in a release.
Hector previously pleaded guilty to counts of raping and abusing a child and possessing child pornography, prosecutors said.

title: Is Erewhon coming to Boston?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News A cryptic Instagram post from the luxury grocery store suggests expansion plans in Boston.
Downtown Boston.
Will Bostonians finally get the chance to pay $20 for a strawberry or viral smoothies at Erewhon, the famous California-based luxury grocery store?

title: A Springfield man was sentenced for murdering his wife. It wasn’t the first time.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Four decades after he was convicted of murdering his wife, Kenneth Robson pleaded guilty to killing another spouse.

By Abby Patkin September 30, 2025 | 3:52 PM 1 minute to read A Springfield man has been sentenced to 25 years to life in prison for killing his wife, a slaying that came 40 years after he was convicted of murdering a previous spouse.
Kenneth Robson, 68, recently pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in the death of 45-year-old Quitiza Holmes, the Hampden County District Attorney’s Office said.
